body: Dear Honeybeeers!  I want to create a vertical test grid behind a facade to see how much annual solar radiation is penetrating the glazing the results would look just like the attached except that the test grid would be directly behind the facade and vertical  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lIRmyKZrZcnDzVgG5aqYwBn7mabVqpi7QQy-psipC2dRn*DbMfqfH5w-3IV7g9AieQFWNfPzk0TzSkT*0RjbkGHJ6SBnw52o/Annualsolarradiation2.jpg)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lIRmyKZrZcn2w5OIGI4XYjwL*30vM1FHvWgLlIhCMRBTMQtYvVyPlKtc9ZLFNyBRhc*XXGn0uhMf*z5SLoeQhcg6pgADcsKM/Annualsolarradiation.jpg)Perhaps I am missing something but I do not know how to do this, as I do not know how to create the points and the mesh to feed into the analysis Recipe component other than using the Honeybee generate test points component. (see below) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lIRmyKZrZcnNKsDVqUG3ulA0PZIxJa-tdeDhlasidkcB2X8w9yfKSg7az1SzURjUAowJDuVEtM81KAQgB5gcaT304I8WMByr/exampleworkflow.JPG) Can someone please show me how to create a vertical test grid?
topic: Creating vertical test grid for the run radiance component

replies.body: Use genTestPoints instead and create a vertical surface as the testSurface. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/lIRmyKZrZclNvpFTib22Il0nQN1cp81ApQV5**UHQUWUw9UUEt82XexVaK2nX1cdMjXJC4p3cSdxLk64bEDMA2A5D9WtRlyz/verticalTestPoints.png)
